title: Traditional Bowyer's Bible Complete Set
description:
The Traditional Bowyers Bibles contain the most comprehensive, in-depth bow building knowledge base ever assembled. If you've ever wanted to build selfbows this set is the best resource you could ever hope to find. A group effort by top primitive bowyers. Each volume is edited by J. Hamm.

See Traditional Bowyers Bible Volume 1
The first of a set of four covers Step-by-step guides from many of today's top primitive bowyers. Comprehensive coverage of topics from tree to bow. Paperback. Well illustrated. 324 pages. 

See Traditional Bowyers Bible Volume 2
This second volume in a set of four covers bending wood, composite bows, string making, ancient European bows and more. Hardcover (for now). 313 pages.

See Traditional Bowyers Bible Volume 3
The third book in a series of four, this volume explores Plains Indian bows, arrows, quivers, stone age bows, bow making tools, horn bows, takedown bows, flint arrowheads and more. Paperback. 351 pages.

See Traditional Bowyers Bible Volume 4
Covers heat-treating bows, the mass principle, character bows, design and performance, laminated wood bows, Ishi's archery tackle, and many other ground-breaking chapters. Paperback and 330 pages
